Today, Betty went to the bookstore. Between what times could they have gone?
We know that:
Betty woke up at 8am.
Nancy saw Betty waiting at the airport from 8am to 10am.
Tiffany saw Betty stretching at a yoga studio from 10am to 2pm.
James saw Betty reading at the library from 2pm to 4pm.
Steven saw Betty buying a bike at the bike shop from 4pm to 5pm.
Mary saw Betty taking photos near the Leaning Tower of Pisa from 5pm to 6pm.
The bookstore was closed after 8pm.
Between what times could Betty have gone to the bookstore?
Options:
(A) 2pm to 4pm
(B) 10am to 2pm
(C) 8am to 10am
(D) 6pm to 8pm

How would a typical person answer each of the following questions about causation?
Lauren and Jane work for the same company. They each need to use a computer for work sometimes. Unfortunately, the computer isn't very powerful. If two people are logged on at the same time, it usually crashes. So the company decided to institute an official policy. It declared that Jane would be the only one permitted to use the computer in the mornings and that Lauren would be the only one permitted to use the computer in the afternoons. As expected, Jane logged on the computer the next day at 9:00 am. But Lauren decided to disobey the official policy. She also logged on at 9:00 am. The computer crashed immediately. Did Jane cause the computer to crash?
Options:
- Yes
- No

The following translations from German to English contain a particular error. That error will be one of the following types: Named Entities: An entity (names, places, locations, etc.) is changed to a different entity. Numerical Values: Numerical values (ordinals or cardinals), dates, and/or units are changed. Modifiers or Adjectives: The modifiers and adjectives pertaining to a noun are changed. Negation or Antonyms: Introduce or remove a negation or change comparatives to their antonyms. Facts: Trivial factual errors not pertaining to the above classes are introduced in the translations. Dropped Content: A significant clause in the translation is removed. Please identify that error.  Source: Die Liste der Kulturgüter in Roggwil TG enthält alle Objekte in der Gemeinde Roggwil im Kanton Thurgau, die gemäss der Haager Konvention zum Schutz von Kulturgut bei bewaffneten Konflikten, dem Bundesgesetz vom 20.
Translation: The list of cultural assets in Roggwil TG contains all objects in the municipality of Roggwil in the canton of Thurgau, which, in accordance with the Prague Convention for the Protection of Cultural Property in the event of armed conflict, are protected by the Federal Act of 20 May 1898.
The translation contains an error pertaining to
Options:
(A) Modifiers or Adjectives
(B) Numerical Values
(C) Negation or Antonyms
(D) Named Entities
(E) Dropped Content
(F) Facts

How would a typical person answer each of the following questions about causation?
Prof. Smith works at a large university. At this university, in order to get new computers from the university, faculty like Prof. Smith must send an application to two administrative committees, the IT committee and the department budget committee. Prof. Smith will be able to get her new computers if the IT committee approves her application or the department budget committee approves her application. Only one of the committees needs to approve her application for her to get the new computers. The IT committee almost always approves these applications. The department budget committee almost never approves these applications. The budget committee is notorious for turning down almost every application they receive. Prof. Smith sends in her applications. Each committee meets independently and they decide without talking to each other, but their meetings are scheduled for the exact same time. The IT committee approves her application, and surprisingly, the department budget committee approves her application. So, Prof. Smith got her new computers. Does the department budget committee cause the approval of Prof. Smith's application?
Options:
- Yes
- No

(D) Amy finished second-to-last
(E) Mel finished second-to-last

Throughout the song, the dancers often trade partners. First, Gertrude and Alice switch partners. Then, Dave and Claire switch partners. Then, Bob and Claire switch partners. At the end of the dance, Bob is dancing with

(B) Sam

Today, Andrew went to the coffee shop. Between what times could they have gone?
We know that:
Andrew woke up at 8am.
Elizabeth saw Andrew fixing their computer at the electronic store from 11am to 3pm.
Jennifer saw Andrew buying a bike at the bike shop from 3pm to 4pm.
Anthony saw Andrew buying cookies at a bakery from 4pm to 6pm.
Betty saw Andrew watching a movie at the theater from 6pm to 8pm.
The coffee shop was closed after 8pm.
Between what times could Andrew have gone to the coffee shop?
Options:
(A) 3pm to 4pm
(B) 6pm to 8pm
(C) 8am to 11am
(D) 11am to 3pm

The following translations from German to English contain a particular error. That error will be one of the following types: Named Entities: An entity (names, places, locations, etc.) is changed to a different entity. Numerical Values: Numerical values (ordinals or cardinals), dates, and/or units are changed. Modifiers or Adjectives: The modifiers and adjectives pertaining to a noun are changed. Negation or Antonyms: Introduce or remove a negation or change comparatives to their antonyms. Facts: Trivial factual errors not pertaining to the above classes are introduced in the translations. Dropped Content: A significant clause in the translation is removed. Please identify that error.  Source: Badeni ist eine polnische Hochadelsfamilie.
Translation: Banzini is a Polish noble family.
The translation contains an error pertaining to
Options:
(A) Modifiers or Adjectives
(B) Numerical Values
(C) Negation or Antonyms
(D) Named Entities
(E) Dropped Content
(F) Facts
